abstract: The cancellation comes after Edward J. Snowden’s revelations that the National Security Agency had routine access to global data provided by telecom companies.
snippet: The cancellation comes after Edward J. Snowden’s revelations that the National Security Agency had routine access to global data provided by telecom companies.
lead_paragraph: LONDON — Germany said on Thursday that it would cancel a contract with Verizon Communications, part of the fallout from continuing revelations by Edward J. Snowden, a former National Security Agency contractor, who says that American intelligence agencies had routine access to global data provided by telecom companies.

headline.main: Irked by N.S.A., Germany Cancels Deal With Verizon
headline.print_headline: Irked by N.S.A., Germany Cancels Deal With Verizon
